page.title: 18Farms In The Highworth Area.
page.content: In our area there are 7 farms, the smallest is about 100 acres and the largest is 760 acres. The average size is about 440 acres. The farms produce milk, beef and cereals.They are fully equipped with tractors, combines and balers.Only 3 or 4 men are employed on each farm.1 man can now plough 30 acres in one day. Wheat and barley are planted in the autumn and harvested in late summer.They are sold for around about Â£100 a ton.They are dried by modern machinery and controlled by computers. The livestock comprised of cattle;3 farms had dairy herds and 3 had beef.The cost of a cow was about Â£500.Most of the cows were freiesian. Pests like warble fly and worms are treated by inoculation. Fungal diseases are treated by spraying with chemicals.
